title: "What is the Secret of the Turba Philosophorum and How to Create the Mysterious Stone?"
first_phrase: This text is a part of a book called "Turba Philosophorum". The text uses allegories to explain the process of making the Philosopher's Stone. The author presents a riddle, "this thing has three angles in its substance, four in its virtue, two in its matter, and one in its root," and goes on to explain the steps and ingredients to create the Stone. In the last 200 tokens, the author explains how to make the garment or "vestment" using the substance of the Stone, which is achieved by cooking it in "permanent water" for forty days and then freezing it. The resulting "fat stone" is called "Dasma". The author also mentions the use of white salt to dry the substance and avoid a bad odor.
